channel.title: The Chicago lectures
channel.description:
This series presents lectures given at University of Chicago, focusing on the nature of human beings, their place in the universe, and their potentialities. The lectures were also published in The Bulletin of Atomic Scientists, beginning in September 1965.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Clifford Geertz, part 2
item.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by Clifford Geertz of the University of Chicago: "The Impact of the Concept of Culture on the Concept of Man."
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: George Wald, part 2
item.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by George Wald of Harvard University: "Biological Determinacy, Individuality, and the Problem of Free Will."
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc
